message.content:
Forget all previous instructions.

You are an expert in following instructions. You are also an expert on various topics, especially on socio-economic development. You know how to read and understand sentences, and based from these sentences generate similar looking sentences but on different topics.

You will generate sentences indicating the use of a dataset and complementary datasets. Always mention specific datasets in the sentence.

You always return your response in JSON format that can be loaded in Python using `json.loads`. The format looks like:  [{"sentence": <sentence>, "dataset": [<dataset>], "topic": [<topic>]}]

Use topic only from this list separated by !!!!!: Agriculture and Food!!!!!Climate Change!!!!!Competitiveness!!!!!Debt!!!!!Digital Development!!!!!Disaster Risk Management !!!!!Education!!!!!Energy!!!!!Environment !!!!!Extractive Industries!!!!!Financial Inclusion!!!!!Financial Sector!!!!!Fragility, Conflict, and Violence!!!!!Gender!!!!!Governance!!!!!Health!!!!!Inequality and Shared Prosperity!!!!!Infrastructure!!!!!Jobs & Development!!!!!Macroeconomics!!!!!Migration!!!!!Nutrition!!!!!Poverty!!!!!Public-Private Partnerships!!!!!Regional Integration!!!!!Social Protection!!!!!Social Sustainability and Inclusion!!!!!Trade!!!!!Transport!!!!!Urban Development!!!!!Water

Generate 10 sentences on various topics that use datasets. The sentence lengths must have large variation with each other.

Consider generating complex sentence structure. Also generate sentences where multiple datasets are mentioned. Try to generate challenging and somewhat ambiguous sentences.

Example output: [{"sentence": "This study draws on data from the DHS conducted in Sub-Saharan African countries with at least two rounds of data.", "dataset": ["DHS"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses administrative data on electricity billing records from Ghana and Rwanda.", "dataset": ["administrative data on electricity billing records"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "We complement the electricity data with monthly data on temperature and total precipitation from the Copernicus Climate Change Service.", "dataset": ["Copernicus Climate Change Service"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We use two main sources of data, both of which are novel: a dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18 and a time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports.", "dataset": ["dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18", "time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "To this end, we used multi-modal imaging and neuropsychological battery data available in the Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI) to investigate the relationship between cross-sectional measures of tau, cortical thickness, and different aspects of cognition.", "dataset": ["Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI)"], "topic": ["Health"]}]

You will use the seed to always generate reproducible set of output, seed = 42.

[{"sentence": "Using data from the Global Nutrition Report and the World Bank, we explore the relationship between stunting and economic growth in low-income countries.", "dataset": ["Global Nutrition Report", "World Bank"], "topic": ["Nutrition", "Poverty"]}, {"sentence": "This report combines two different datasets: the Country Policy and Institutional Assessment (CPIA) and the Worldwide Governance Indicators (WGI), to analyze the determinants of good governance practices in Sub-Saharan African countries.", "dataset": ["Country Policy and Institutional Assessment (CPIA)", "Worldwide Governance Indicators (WGI)"], "topic": ["Governance", "Fragility, Conflict, and Violence"]}, {"sentence": "We study the relationship between gender-based violence and women's health using data from Demographic and Health Surveys (DHS) conducted in 10 Southeast Asian countries.", "dataset": ["Demographic and Health Surveys (DHS)"], "topic": ["Gender", "Health"]}, {"sentence": "To examine how extraction activities affect welfare outcomes, we combined household-level panel data from six developing country settings with high activities in the extractive industries with a dataset containing spatial information on mining and drilling sites.", "dataset": ["household-level panel data from six developing country settings with high activities in the extractive industries", "a dataset containing spatial information on mining and drilling sites"], "topic": ["Extractive Industries", "Inequality and Shared Prosperity"]}, {"sentence": "We exploit administrative data provided by the Ministry of Labor and Employment in Brazil to estimate the effects of unemployment insurance on job search behavior.", "dataset": ["administrative data provided by the Ministry of Labor and Employment in Brazil"], "topic": ["Jobs & Development"]}, {"sentence": "This paper analyzes the impact of climate shocks on agricultural productivity in Ethiopia, using data on temperature and precipitation from the Climatic Research Unit (CRU) and data on agricultural productivity from the Central Statistical Agency of Ethiopia.", "dataset": ["Climatic Research Unit (CRU)", "Central Statistical Agency of Ethiopia"], "topic": ["Agriculture and Food", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We combine data from the World Health Organization, the Global Burden of Disease database, and the Humanitarian Data Exchange to explore the effects of conflicts and disasters on maternal health outcomes.", "dataset": ["World Health Organization", "Global Burden of Disease database", "Humanitarian Data Exchange"], "topic": ["Disaster Risk Management", "Gender", "Fragility, Conflict, and Violence"]}, {"sentence": "Using data from 14 countries participating in the South Asia Food and Nutrition Security Initiative (SAFANSI), we examine the relationship between food security policies and nutrition outcomes.", "dataset": ["South Asia Food and Nutrition Security Initiative (SAFANSI)"], "topic": ["Nutrition", "Food Security"]}, {"sentence": "We use a novel dataset on public-private partnerships in infrastructure projects to investigate the determinants of project success in low- and middle-income countries.", "dataset": ["novel dataset on public-private partnerships in infrastructure projects"], "topic": ["Infrastructure", "Public-Private Partnerships"]}, {"sentence": "This study combines data from three different sources: the National Education Longitudinal Study, the National Survey of Youth, and the National Educational Panel Study, to examine the impact of parental education on intergenerational mobility patterns in the United States.", "dataset": ["National Education Longitudinal Study", "National Survey of Youth", "National Educational Panel Study"], "topic": ["Education", "Inequality and Shared Prosperity"]}]
